['Managing bugs company-wide.', 'Interviewing customers, artists, and partners on a regular basis.', 'Aiding our product managers by keeping projects moving (following up on blockers and getting answers to questions following project planning meetings, connecting developers with the information they need to do their job, gathering assets, etc.)', 'Overseeing and managing the implementation of "single-ticket" projects', 'Communicating with stakeholders in order to keep them informed of changing priority and project decisions.', 'Reviewing and analyzing data around upcoming and completed projects.', 'Reporting on development resource allocation.', 'Actively managed by the Marketplace PM (growth), but report equally to all PMs for workload/tasks/etc.', "Bugs: Manage the bugs inbox by communicating with stakeholders to replicate the bug, understand it's context, and then triage it with the development team.", "User Interviews: Scheduling a weekly customer, artist, and partner interview, as well as take turns with Marketplace PM in conducting the interview. When you conduct the interview you'll organize and report back valuable insights.", "Process Flow Lead: For each project we have a number of meetings (kickoff, ticketing, and some planning meetings). Additionally, we have regular planning meetings (sprint planning, backlog grooming, etc.) We have 3–6 of these per week per development team. You'll attend these meetings and handle the follow ups that come out afterwards. This includes gathering data points, sitting down with developers to develop solutions, writing user stories, communicating with stakeholders to product manage roadblocks, and problem solving solutions to trade-offs.", "End-to-end PM of Single Tickets Projects: There are many non-epic level projects you'll be product managing (ex. storefront search on artist pages). You'll oversee from start to finish. You'll identify a problem, work with stakeholders + UI/UX designers + developers to come up with a solution, pitch the solution to the PM, prepare dev for the project, and see that project through to completion, ultimately measuring success.", "End-to-end PM of Smaller Epics: As you settle into this role, you'll begin to oversee smaller epic-level projects end-to-end (ex. Product Page Mobile Optimizations, Copy Existing Design Settings, Partner Integrations). So in addition to the steps outlined above (identify a problem, work with stakeholders + UI/UX designers + developers to come up with a solution, pitch the solution to the PM, prepare dev for the project, and see that project through to completion, ultimately measuring success) you'll also lead kickoff and ticketing meetings, fully driving the success of these projects.", "Discovery + Data Analysis: You'll aid our PMs in data-driven research to find product opportunities, determine the potential impact of products in order to help us triage, and measure success of projects.", "Stakeholder Communication: You'll triage and problem solve project roadblocks with stakeholder, using your PM skills to understand the goal of the project, what routes are available to unblock us, and work with stakeholders + UI/UX designers + developers to problem solve and keep everyone up-to-date.", "Stakeholder Meeting: You'll accompany our PMs to stakeholder meetings in order to be up-to-date with business operations and opportunities in order to aid you in decision making. You will eventually take over some of these meetings.", "QC: You'll review projects on launch, looking for bugs and ensuring they fulfill all acceptance criteria, before accepting them into our production environment.", "Resource Allocation: You'll aid our PMs in doing monthly resource allocation for the financial team.", 'Experience in startup environments: comfortable working in a scrappy, roll-up-your-sleeves atmosphere.', 'Product essentials: Experience working with developers and stakeholders on project management related work.', 'Self starter: A self-starter who puts their head down and gets it done.', 'Nimble: A fan of learning on the fly, deducing, and listening closely.', 'Technically minded: Ability to dialogue with product and engineering teams, write tickets for developers, and translate technical details to non-technical stakeholders.', 'Marketing chops: General understanding of e-commerce, conversion funnels, A/B testing, and experience working in GTM and Google Analytics.', 'Consumer focused: An eye towards best-in-class consumer experiences inspired by industry best practices and paying attention to competitors in and out of the e-commerce content creation space.', "Detail oriented: You make sure all the T's are crossed and the I's are dotted.", 'Leadership mindset: Strategic thinker comfortable with digging into metrics and communicating status with senior leadership.', 'End-to-end feature ownership: Comfortable identifying and diagnosing problems, supporting hypotheses through data, proposing solutions, overseeing execution, and communicating results.', '4-year college degree.', 'Bonus Skills: A background in either design, development, or marketing would be helpful!']

job_title: Sr Data Scientist (work from home position)
job_text: ['Utilize advanced statistical techniques to create high performing predictive models and creative analyses to address business objectives and client needs. Tests new statistical analysis methods, software and data sources for continual improvement of quantitative solutions.', 'Work with Business SMEs to create models which predict the outcome of key business processes', 'Lead and contribute to data analysis and modeling projects from project or prototype design', 'Gathering and analyzing data, identifying key prediction/classification problems, devising solutions and building prototypes.', 'Follow industry trends in related data analytics processes and businesses.', 'Develop high-performance algorithms for predictive analytics. Testing and implementing these algorithms in scalable, product-ready code.', 'Ideal candidate will possess a PhD with at least 3+ years of data science expertise; However candidates with equivalent and relevant years of experience in lieu of Post graduate Degree will be reviewed', 'Advanced applied statistics skills, such as distributions, statistical testing, regression, etc.', 'Excellent understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, etc.', 'Strong algorithmic problem solving and software development skills (R, Python, or similar)', 'Demonstrated capability to develop proof-of-concept prototypes for experimenting with novel algorithms', 'Demonstrated experience and accomplishments in the use of data mining, machine learning, and predictive analytics to address real-life problems.', 'Past experience in analyzing large scale data and distributed algorithms', 'Excellent analytical, communication (both verbal and written), interpersonal, and organizational skills.', 'Must be able to communicate effectively and clearly present technical approaches and findings.', 'LI-EH1']

['Oversee all marketing for the company, including product marketing, brand management, lead generation, sales enablement, thought leadership and content marketing, social media and public relations.', 'Serve as the company’s brand steward responsible for evolving the company’s messaging and brand based on existing brand guidelines.', 'Maintain and deliver ongoing content updates to Paysign.com. Track effectiveness of the site using Google Analytics, improving SEO over time.', 'Direct the company’s social media activities and determine how best to use content to increase social media followers and visitors to our website.', 'Determine the digital lead gen strategies across Paysign’s suite of products and implement test and learn activities, ensuring a positive ROI. ['Have direct experience leading a team and client through website redesigns before. Ideally you’ll have 40-50 website projects under your belt at a minimum.', 'Be able to lead. This role requires someone who can take command of a room and ensure meetings are a positive and effective experience.', 'Be comfortable working directly with clients, managing expectations, and explaining complex issues at whatever level of technical understanding they may have and championing their mission and passion for our team.', 'Be able to manage and maintain client relationships, coordinating with the team to ensure efforts are aligned with their objectives, and that calls and meetings are an upbeat and positive experience.', 'Understand the principles of marketing that gets results. This includes understanding the buyers journey, conversion orientation, calls to action, landing pages, autoresponders, drip email campaigns, squeeze pages, redemption pages and more.', 'Understand content marketing, search engine optimization, conversion rate optimization, marketing automation, and the slew of related and affiliated elements that affect these practices. (Experience with platforms like WordPress, Hubspot, Mailchimp, Google Analytics, etc. is great.)', 'Be well versed in traditional marketing communications skills including but not limited to copywriting, blogging, public relations, basic graphic design, web design best practices,', 'Understand the role these elements – and the website as a whole – relate to each client’s organizational objectives and goals.', 'Be able to wear many hats, and change them quickly. In a single day, you may lead a client call to create strategy, sketch out a landing page, draft emails to clients, collaborate on a home page design, provide feedback on a client video or animation, collaborate with your team to draft new content and CTA ideas for approval, present a proposal, and then grab lunch.', 'Ideally have experience working in a similar position in an ad agency or web design firm. Alternatively have experience serving in a similar capacity virtually or on your own as an entrepreneur or contractor.', 'Be self-motivated and take initiative. If you’re the kind of person who waits for someone to tell you what to do, this isn’t your kind of place.', 'Be passionate about your work. As an agency we know the impact we have on the world is through the way we amplify our clients’ impact. For that reason we work only with people with whom we’re well aligned. That goes for clients and employees.']

job_title: Senior Direct Response Performance Marketer -- SEM
job_text: ['Own highly visible Google and Bing SEM customer acquisition campaigns including responsibility for headlines and landing pages, scheduling and testing.', 'Determine and deploy SEM strategy.', 'Measure and analyze performance, and identify new opportunities based on customer and business data.', 'Develop strategic marketing plans for SEM as well as other content marketing channels. Paid media will focus on search but may also include display ads, native, and social media channels.', 'Assess and develop new digital advertising opportunities.', 'Implement and continually test new creative messaging, landing pages, campaigns, and tools.', 'Drive rapid but well-structured campaign testing designed to validate the potential of digital channels and audiences.', '3+ years’ experience in a performance marketing role, preferably in the personal finance space', 'Strong understanding of SEM strategy.', 'Experience with Google Adwords and Bing Ads for search required. Bonus points for any of the other large ad platforms: Facebook, Yahoo Gemini, Taboola, Outbrain, Dianomi, Criteo, etc.', 'Well versed in direct response marketing principles and methodologies.', 'Proven track record of successful online marketing campaigns and experiments- owning campaign performance and adjusting tactics to meet objectives and budgets.', 'Excellent analytical and quantitative skills, a passion for metrics and quantitative analysis, ability to turn analysis into actionable programs, and ability to use data to optimize day-to-day performance.', 'Relentless drive to beat the control.', 'Ability to bridge data analysis, research, competitive intelligence, and marketing savvy to build efficient and scalable customer acquisition programs.', 'Experience running your own P&L, having owned marketing budgets and revenue goals of significant scale.', 'Must be highly driven with a customer-centric attitude and the ability to work entrepreneurially on a small team.', 'No “vacation policy” (not to be confused with a “No vacation” policy)', 'Paid maternity, paternity, and pet-ernity leave', '$1,000 deposit into your brokerage account when you start', 'Super low premiums for medical, dental and vision coverage', 'Competitive compensation package, including company equity', '$1,000 deposit into your brokerage account when you start', 'Super low premiums for medical, dental and vision coverage', 'Competitive compensation package, including company equity']

If you’ve worked with it at scale, apply, even if you don’t meet every single qualification, please apply! And your birthday, Valentine’s day, and a half-day on Halloween. If you’re in costume. Seriously.', 'An inclusive office environment, a gong, brownie bake-offs, and the best coworkers you could ask for.', 'Medical and dental premiums fully covered by us. Mhmm. You read that right.', 'Five (or six? We’re losing count.) different ways of making coffee.', 'An incredibly compelling reason to wake up and make it to work every day.', 'DoSomething.org is an equal opportunity employer.', 'DoSomething.org is one of the largest organizations in the world focused on young people and social change. DoSomething Strategic is the consulting arm of DoSomething.org. Our 6 million+ members take action, online and offline, to better their communities by participating in one of our 250+ cause campaigns.', 'We collect and retain data that is included in your job application. This includes your full name, contact information, and any personal information disclosed in your resume, cover letter, and other supplemental application materials.', 'Data is collected for evaluation criteria when seeking employment at DoSomething', 'We will only use your data for what was originally intended - for purposes of seeking and gaining employment at DoSomething. Your data will not be “recycled” for marketing emails or to sell to third parties.', 'DoSomething will retain candidate profiles for 3 years.', 'Annually on August 1, candidate profiles from 3+ years prior will be entirely deleted from our system.', 'JazzHR maintains secure job board pages. Job boards will default to HTTPS. Additionally, if we were to terminate our contract with JazzHR our candidate data is deleted from JazzHR’s systems in accordance with JazzHR’s Terms of Service.']
